name: Microsoft Excel - From Beginner to Advanced
introduction: A Beginner's Guide to Microsoft Excel - Learn Excel Charts, Spreadsheets, Formulas, Shortcuts, Macros and Tips & Tricks
author: Md. Sadiken Kabir

description.intro: Either you're new to Microsoft Excel, or you've played around with Excel since long but want to get more comfortable with MS Excel's advanced features, or maybe you want to enhance your data analysis skills using Microsoft Excel. Either way, this Excel course will be great for you.
features: Mathematical formulas such as SUM, AVERAGE,RAND, MIN & MAX, SUMPRODUCT.
Textual formulas such as TRIM, CONCATENATE, SUBSTITUTE, UPPER & LOWER, LENGTH, LEFT, RIGHT & MID.
Logical formulas such as AND & OR, IF, COUNTIF, SUMIF.
Date-time related functions such as TODAY & NOW, DAY, MONTH & YEAR, DATEDIF & DAYS
Lookup formulas such as VLOOKUP, HLOOKUP, INDEX, MATCH.
Data operating tools such as Data Sorting and Filtering, Data validation, Removing duplicates, Importing Data (Text-to-columns)
Data formatting options such as coloring, changing font, alignments and table formatting options such as adding borders, having highlighted table headers, banded rows etc.
Charts such as, Bar/ Column chart, Line Chart, Scatter Plot, Pie & Doughnut charts, Statistical Chart - Histogram, Waterfall, Sparklines
Some important shortcuts and teach you how to find out the shortcut for any particular excel operation.
Data analytics options available in Excel such as Regression, Solving linear programming problem (Minimization or Maximization problems), What-if (Goal Seek and Scenario Manager)
The process of recording a Macro, running a Macro and creating a button to run a Macro.
Waterfall chart in Excel 2016 and previous versions of Excel, Infographics 1: Cool charts, Infographics 2: Cool charts.
description.conclusion: By the end of this course, your confidence in using MS Excel will soar. You will learn how Microsoft Excel can play a pivotal role in data analysis and related field. You'll also have a thorough understanding of how to use Microsoft Excel for study or as a career opportunity.

name: Microsoft PowerBI Desktop for Business Intelligence
introduction: Master Power BI Desktop & learn advanced Power BI analysis & data visualization with a top Microsoft Power BI instructor
author: Md. Sadiken Kabir

description.intro: You want to analyze data from single or multiple sources? You want to create your individual datasets based on these sources and transform your results into beautiful and easy-to-make visualizations? You also want to share your results with colleagues or collaborate on your projects? Then the Power BI tools are the tools to choose for you!
features: Get to know the different tools of the Power BI universe and learn how to use them
Understand Power BI Desktop and its components
Learn how to use the Query Editor to connect Power BI to various source types, how to work on the Data Model and understand the difference between those two steps
Learn how to filter and format data, how pivoting and unpivoting works
How to work in the different views of the Data Model
How to create calculated columns and measures
How to build relationships between different tables
How to create a report with different interactive visualization types
Learn how to use Power BI Pro to create dashboards and to share and publish your result
How to access your results from multiple devices using Power BI Mobile
description.conclusion: By the time you complete this course, you'll be a highly proficient Power BI user. You will be using your skills as a data scientist to extract knowledge from data so you can analyze and visualize complex questions with ease.

name: Probability and Statistics for Business and Data Science
introduction: Learn how to apply probability and statistics to real data science and business applications!
author: Md. Sadiken Kabir

description.intro: Welcome to Probability and Statistics for Business and Data Science!In this course we cover what you need to know about probability and statistics to succeed in business and the data science field! This practical course will go over theory and implementation of statistics to real world problems. Each section has example problems, in course quizzes, and assessment tests.
description.conclusion: We'll cover everything you need to know about statistics and probability to clearly tackle real world business and data science problems! So what are you waiting for? Enroll today and we'll see you inside the course!

name: Complete Data Analysis with Python Bootcamp

This creates a sizeable gap between the skills you need on the job and the abilities you have acquired in training. Truth be told, real-world data is messy, so you need to know how to overcome this obstacle to become an independent data professional.
features: Theory about the field of data analytics
description.conclusion: The course contains plenty of exercises and practical cases. In the end, we have included a comprehensive practical example that will show you how everything you have learned along the way comes nicely together. This is where you will be able to appreciate how far you have come in your journey to becoming a data analyst and starting your data career.
